review.title: A room and a bed, exactly what I needed.
review.reviewText: A little aged and worn, but clean. I think someone smoked in my non-smoking room before I got there, but that's hardly the hotel's fault.

review.title: By the 101 and 280
review.reviewText: Mirror was dirty looked like a handprint other than that the stay was pleasant and relaxing.

review.title: Sleeping in South San Francisco!
review.reviewText: This hotel is a close convenient drive to the Cow Palace.  We stay here each time we come to this area. Lots to see and do.  We will come again. We will recommend to everyone.

review.title: Will Not Return
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere.  The rooms are small and cramped. Thankfully I was only there for a night.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly enough and the room was clean
review.negativeRemarks: Unless you are going to relocate the hotel; do some renovations to enlarge the rooms... not much
review.locationRemarks: I am not sure about the neighborhood the hotel is located in... desolate and unkept

review.title: Even Not Average
review.reviewText: Small room and uncomfortable bed , Close to airport but too far from downtown. I won't consider a coffee and cake (TO GO) as breakfast. Please get rid of "breakfast included" ....
This was our last resort and it certainly was just that.
review.negativeRemarks: The "lobby"...there was none!  Breakfast should be renamed "limited morning low grade snack".
review.locationRemarks: Close to airport but too close to the freeway...way too much traffic noise.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: A place to lay your head. Not fancy. No fitness center or pool.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay because it os near airport and not far from the city.

review.title: A little sketchy
review.reviewText: Very small, non-existent lobby, and overpriced for what you get. Only stay here if you have no other option.

review.title: Close to Airport
review.reviewText: What we expected, does the job for a one night stay near the airport. Airport shuttle was nice. Breakfast I would hardly call breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Airport

review.title: Nice Inn ten minutes from the airport.
review.reviewText: I got there last room and it was the Lord's blessing because I had  reservation at the Holiday Inn but when I got there someone gave it away. So I had to find another room. The Lord knew that I would need that room so he kept it open for me all day.I was amazed because the room was great, better than the Holiday Inns.

review.title: Nice Inn ten minutes from the airport.
review.reviewText: I got there last room and it was the Lord's blessing because I had  reservation at the Holiday Inn but when I got there someone gave it away. So I had to find another room. The Lord knew that I would need that room so he kept it open for me all day.I was amazed because the room was great, better than the Holiday Inns.

review.title: Not very nice
review.reviewText: Lots of highway noise, and my non-smoking room smelled like smoke. Room next door had 3 guys who smoked, so they smoked and talked right outside my door. I don't expect much from a Days Inn, but this place underwhelmed, especially for the price tag of $260 a night.
review.positiveRemarks: It was better than sleeping on the streets.
review.negativeRemarks: You name it.

review.reviewText: Good room, clean and plenty of space. Easy parking. Good location

review.title: Friendly Staff & took me to airport.
review.reviewText: Great experience  check in was 3 but I got in at 1130 am super tired & they let me in my room to rest way early... Thanks again

review.title: Not bad, but not the greatest
review.reviewText: The hotel is a 3 star hotel at the most... but I knocked it down a point due to value vs what you get. The room was comfortable, but very little nearby unless you have a car.  It's conveniently close to the airport with an on demand shuttle.   The rooms are noisy as it's right next to the highway.  Internet is so-so.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise isolation, internet speeds.
review.locationRemarks: Not much to do nearby.

review.title: Worst
review.reviewText: My non smoking room smelled like cigarettes.   No soap.  Stained pillowcases.  Sink and shower would not drain.   Toilet was plugged.

review.title: Not quiet
review.reviewText: Since there is no carpet in rooms, you can hear people above walking around.  Add to that the freeway noise close by, this place is not for light sleepers.  Brakfast consists of coffee and a cello wrapped roll.  Rooms were clean and the price is cheap.  So you get what you pay for.

review.title: Noise was the biggest issue
review.reviewText: For the money, the hotel had the expected facilities and maintenance.  it overlooks multiple major roadways and the noise is deafening. i had to sleep with earplugs and even then i didn't have a restful sleep
review.negativeRemarks: Additional soundproofing of the windows.

review.title: Okay, but not quite.
review.reviewText:
The room was okay and bed was okay. 
The bad things --- 
- when i threw something on the garbage, i noticed that the garbage bin had something in it. When i checked, i kid you not, there was a used condom and condom wrapper. (Crown). Yaikz... 
- the bed was squeeking everytime you turn. 
- the maid tried to come in and clean at 8am, when we were still inside sleeping. They didnt check at the front if we already checked out. 
Terrible experience...

review.title: Worst hotel stay yet
review.reviewText: No curtains on lg window,light outside window with shutters lets all light in,bedding old and wore out,small rm,employees moving cars beeping horns all night

review.title: Avoid this hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel shuttle took nearly 40 minutes to arrive and dropped me off at this motel/no tell. The lobby is in the corner of a small parking area and was the size of a bathroom. A nice view of the busy and loud freeway greets you at your door. The microwave was from 1980 and the bed too!
review.positiveRemarks: The singular staff was reasonably friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Tear down and rebuild.
review.locationRemarks: The parking lot is adjacent to the freeway.

review.reviewText: Bad terrible sheets dirty not a the best it should be cheaper than it is

review.title: Days inn stay
review.reviewText: Not enough parking for residents. I had to park down the street.

review.title: Nice things is close to the airport
review.reviewText: This hotel is oK to stay but the hotel not that safe.  the door go up stairs never locked
Very loud, even with the AC on, we can still hear the noise from the freeway.  Would not recommend if you are a light sleeper.

review.title: Very noisy, loud and nobody was ever at the front.
review.reviewText: Not good and would try another, this was our last resort.

review.title: Nice hotel, clean, friendly,
review.reviewText: everything is good, just a little bit far from downtown but close to the airport. i will come back.

review.title: This hotel was perfect for our situation!
review.reviewText:
The overall service was very good and everything requested was setup! It was close to the San Francisco International Airport with prompt shuttle service to and from the Hotel. Information was correct and prompt!
A bus stop was located very close to hotel making it easy to get about!
I would be happy to stay again which could be as soon 12 to 14 months time.
review.positiveRemarks: It's convenience to airport and city! It was clean and comfortable!
review.negativeRemarks: No
review.locationRemarks: See earlier comments!

review.title: Close to the Cow Palace for Events
review.reviewText: We had a very pleasant stay for 3 nights.  Good food nearby and delivery.  We need a smoking room and with many hotels not offering them anymore, we were glad for the convenience.  We will stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked that they didn't invade our room while we were gone for the day.  We don't usually need any maid service.  You can get more towels, etc.
review.negativeRemarks: It's in a busy area of the City, they could use more parking.

review.title: Do not use this motel.
review.reviewText: Loud noise in the room from the highway despite being on the back side of the building.  Front desk (if you can call it not open 24 hours/day. Free transport is only on-the-hour in the morning (perhaps the same all day) and has multiple stops at other motels.  Toilet is so low-to-the floor it seemed like was made for children.  No room service.  Delivered food from in-area Italian restaurant was "never use again" variety. Recommend finding some other place.
review.negativeRemarks: See "experience" above.
review.locationRemarks: Wanted go out for dinner but did not feel comfortable walking around the area (using as a pre-airport morning departure motel).

review.title: Hotel Service was poor
review.reviewText:
Maximum time, i could not see anybody on the reception. Receptionist was mainly hiding behind the doors of small room and customer were waiting at the reception for check-in, check-out. 

Moreover, hotel service staff was kind of rude. I requested if I could get print of my boarding pass from reception. I was given bunch of excuses than providing convincing reason not to print the boarding passes for my international travel.
review.negativeRemarks: service

review.title: Unattractive hotel to close to freeway traffic
review.reviewText: Constant freeway traffic noise; lukewarm shower; toilet that hardly flushed; paltry continental breakfast.  First room smelled like stale tobacco smoke.  At least they updated me to a nicer room.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Needed a nice, cheap, quick hotel and this one did the job

review.title: Free Shuttle to Airport
review.reviewText:
It's a great place to stay if your plans are to catch a plane the nextt morning.
The prompt and polite shuttle service to airport is perfect.  The motel is getting on in age but it's clean. Staff are great.
Breakfast included should not be mentioned in their profile... rather just mention free coffee, fruits and some fresh sweet cakes. 
I would stay again without question.

review.title: Large room with small kitchen
review.reviewText: The room was nice and large; but the TV was lower than the bed and when you lay down to watch tv, your legs are blocking the view:  TV needs to be higher: breakfast was only coffee, apples, muffins and granola bars:  and there is no place to sit so it is called "grab and go" breakfast:  as if we didnt know we could grab our breakfast and go somewhere where there is room to sit.  The backdoor was also not working and I had to go all the way around the hotel to get back in.

review.title: Needs a bigger sign
review.reviewText: It was a little hard to find from the highway 101.

review.title: like a motel 6
review.reviewText: No staff at desk to check in. Had to wait a half hour. Really loud because it's close to 101. Otherwise it's ok. Motel 6 quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Perfect for what I needed and the price
review.reviewText: It was perfect t we spent the night there it was affordable and clean and cozy had a frodge and microwave

review.title: The rooms are good.
review.reviewText:
I stayed for 5 days and the rooms are clean.  twice they forgot to leave towels in the room.  I tried to extend my stay there for 2 more nights but none was available.  The customer service was terrible.

The 24hrs restaurant there was awesome..love it..the only downfall are the people working in the front desk.  They need customer service training
Broken doors and unstable Internet, really makes it inconvenient to me

review.title: Loud
review.reviewText:
I know the hotel was cheap but never expected to be awake all night. The walls are so thin if youre not hearing the couple next door you can hear the freeway traffic
It's just out dated and everything is old. The towels actually were so old they had holes in them.  Ii guess you pay for what you get.  
As far as the breakfast, that's a joke.  The fruit was all rotten and don't see how they even put it out.
Never again .
review.positiveRemarks: Staff. But like other reviewers , you have to wait because they are not around.
review.negativeRemarks: Update and make it look clean.  Buy new towels and linens

review.title: Great service and staff, hotel is pretty nice too.
review.reviewText: The lady at the front desk was very warm and welcoming, she let us check in early after confirming that the room was ready. She helped us find our way about and even pulled out a pamphlet of the bus schedules and drew all over it to make sure we got there and back again ok. The room was very nice, quite clean, good TV channels and excellent wifi.
review.positiveRemarks: TV, wifi, close to airport, no hassles.
review.negativeRemarks: Our door was broken albeit lockable. Better water pressure in the shower.
review.locationRemarks: Very little to do. Close to the airport and the bus stop is right across the street.

review.title: Rude staff, won't return
review.reviewText: First of all, we were double charged as if we booked two rooms instead of one.  Since there were three of us, we just went with it and took both.  The staff was rude, unhelpful, and the wifi only worked for about fifteen minutes the entire two nights we were there. The bed was uncomfortable, rooms were not stocked and felt dirty. We will not stay here again!
review.negativeRemarks: See first comments
review.locationRemarks: Near Cow Palace and airport, but if you don't need to be near those places, nothing to do.

review.title: Exact for the price
review.reviewText: Very small parking and the carpet were old. The attendant were very helpful despite the fact that we checked in late.

review.title: Eeeew
review.reviewText: If you like stained sheets, dirty carpets, clogged bath tub, and no customer service, then you'll be right at home.  Continental breakfast offered was, one piece of apple or orange, coffee or juice... Sitting out in the 'lobby'... Ugh.  Checking out ... Couldn't get a final bill and none was emailed as promised.

review.title: Great comy hotel
review.reviewText: I had an extremely pleasant stay. The room was clean and comfortable with great cable.

review.title: Disappointing experience
review.reviewText: We arrived around 6 pm.  There was no one in the tiny, grungy office, which was also called the "lobby". The desk bell was rung a couple of times before someone showed up.  The hotel advertises a continental breakfast in the lobby, but there was only a small counter space allotted for coffee carafes, etc., so I did not expect there would be much of a breakfast. Our room was adequate and comfortable enough.    We called the desk to ask for a 6 am wake up call.  That wake up call never came the following morning.  When we left the hotel at 7 am, there was no one in the office "lobby" and the door was locked.  A sign outside said to use the wall phone to call if you need a room.  Obviously, with a locked Lobby door, there was no breakfast of any kind being served.  There was also no way to check out or return the room key, so we just left the keys in the room.  Non-existent staffing.
review.negativeRemarks: Provide a continental breakfast, as advertised, and actually place wake up calls. Provide room with an extra roll of toilet paper.
review.locationRemarks: It is convenient to the airport, but not a pleasant part of the city. There are restaurants nearby on Grande Ave.

review.title: good hotel for the price...
review.reviewText: good hotel, overall stay was good. Only problem (which was big for me) was that our room was on the 3rd floor and the WiFi for some reason stopped working after like 9PM everyday. the hotel staff could not figure out why and I was left with practically no wifi for 2 days of my stay.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi access points
review.locationRemarks: SFO International airport, Marina point, Fisherman's wharf, Golden Gate park & bridge, Bay Bridge.

review.title: You get what you pey for!
review.reviewText: The staff was alright, janitors kept knocking and I had to tell them 3 times I don't need room service. There were no parking spaces left after 12 midnight so we had to look for one. The room smelled like old furniture, but It was really clean in the room just had some mold in the showed. It's all that a hotel offers towels, shapoo, conditioner, soup, has a microwave, nice tv, coffee maker... You really get what you pay for.. Pluse they are really quite the whole night.

review.title: Not Recommended!!
review.reviewText: This hotel was grossly misrepresented on the web site. It took over an hour to find it even though we were in less than a one mile radius, it is NOT within walking distance to the airport, the room was in various states of disrepair with malfunctioning outlets, stains, and missing outlet covers. The neighborhood was off putting and feared for my safety so I put the dresser and desk in front of the door to block it and still could not sleep. Do not stay here.
Close to family gathering. Elevator for access for elderly guest.

review.title: Nice service
review.reviewText: Enjoyable, and the attitude of the reception is awesome.

review.title: Close to San Francisco Airport
review.reviewText: Basic, close to airport, coffee and danish in the morning.

review.title: Hotel close to airport
review.reviewText: No comments as stay was short. No experience regarding local area except it is also close to downtown South SF.
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed there the night before our flight.

review.title: na
review.reviewText: na okay place, worth price in overpriced market.........

review.title: It looks nicer than it is comfortable.
review.reviewText:
I did not have a good experience staying here. The bed was not comfortable for me, I did not sleep well.
Disappointing experience with the toilet. It would not flush. After three calls and two hours later the maintenance person comes to repair the toilet. It takes about one and one half hours to repair. The manager call to tell me the maintenance person is taking longer than expected and offers me a room change. I declined because I was tired, I already had my belongings settled, and I have severe osteo arthritis. The maintenance person leaves at 9:36 pm.
I call the manager to ask for a comp for another day or a reduced rate. She said NO, because she offered a room chane half hour ago.
If I wasn't tired, already settled and didn't suffer from severe osteo arthritis I would have reconsidered.
However the manager did not consider the INCONVENIENCE AND STRESS it caused me.
For that reason, I will not recommend this place to ANYONE. Tough lesson learned.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer relations. Check to make sure toilet flushes before assigning the room.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants. About thirty minutes away from golden Gate Park.

review.title: Bad manager
review.reviewText: Was awakened at 4am by the manager and was asked to move my car (I was parked correctly btw) because a person was blocking 3 cars and the exit. Why not tow the person? We can't find them she said. It didn't make sense so I did the right thug and moved my car. Them in the morning I asked for some compensation from the hotel and the manager said no and I could have said no to the request to move my car. But the damage was already done by the 4am call to my room.

review.title: Good hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Good hotel for the price especially if you choose to visit SF downtown, fisherman's wharf and all famous landmarks nearby.
review.positiveRemarks: The room facilities like fridge and microwave, location convinience
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast
review.locationRemarks: this is located near the SF Intl airport. SF downtown, fisherman's wharf and all famous landmarks are within 3 mins of driving.

review.title: It was ok...
review.reviewText: ...not a WOW, but it was ok for the price. Very limited breakfast. The room was clean. There was someone very heavy footed on the floor above us that didn't sleep much. Other than that the room was quiet & comfortable. Front desk service by Isabelle was great!
review.negativeRemarks: Space tenants apart as much as possible. If you know there's a person on the floor above, don't put someone in the room below them for foot noise.
review.locationRemarks: The shuttle brought us so it was fairly close to the airport. A convenience store was w/in walking distance. We also ordered in pizza & it was good.

review.title: Absent staff, but nice accomodations.
review.reviewText: They reimburse taxis from the airport, which I imagine eats their profit. And the staff is never around, but available by phone. But if that's no bother to you, it's a great value.
review.negativeRemarks: Staff at the front desk.

review.title: Much better inside than out.
review.reviewText:
The good: bathroom was immaculate, sheets were reasonably clean, room was generally tidy and in good shape. The front desk attendant was friendly and efficient. Airport shuttle was right on time at 4:50 AM and got me there quickly. Bathroom supplies--shampoo, soap, towels, washcloth, etc.--were all stocked and adequate, although the towels were kind of thin and a bit frayed.

The bad: The bed did not have a fitted sheet. When I pulled the covers out the sheet came out with it and became all wrinkled and poked into me. (I finally found a flat spot and fell asleep.) Although the area is probably safe, the outside of the hotel itself looks a bit seedy compared to the higher end hotels nearby; the building could use a significant update. While clean inside, the rooms also need updating, especially the carpeting, towels, and bedding. I had to change from the first, very small room to a second larger room because the heat in the first room didn't work. I was not charged extra. The second room did not have an alarm clock in it, however. On the plus side, although I forgot to mention it to her, the front desk attendant remembered to change my wakeup call from the first room to the second.

Given the prices of hotels in the surrounding area and the ease of getting to the airport, I would say this hotel represents a very good value overall for those who just need an overnight stay to catch a flight the next day.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean, given the fact that it's an old property and needs drastic updating.
review.negativeRemarks: Exterior is not inviting, needs updating outside and inside and a bigger and more welcoming lobby area, just needs a makeover.
review.locationRemarks: Don't know, stayed in to catch an early flight the next day.

review.title: Pretty much what you'd expect.
review.reviewText: A cheap hotel with sub adequate customer service, worn out rooms and nothing particularly going for it. Overall the place was just kind of a mess and needs a good solid cleaning.
review.negativeRemarks: The "continental breakfast" was pretty sorry.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the airport.

review.title: Promises fulfilled. None
review.reviewText: Booked hotel for airport shuttle and continental breakfast. No shuttle service. Waited as shuttle buses came and went. None for days inn. Called hotel. Was told to go down to taxi level and wait at front of line. Finally took a taxi after calling hotel and was told it would be another hour wait. Finally took taxi who could not find address. Listed as airport rd not blvd. $25 fare. Checked in and was told would receive$16 refund at checkout. Outside entrance to room. No lobby. Only small entry with counter and no dining area for breakfast. Coffee breakfast bars and juice on 1'x3' counter. No seating area. Carry paper cups up to room. No tray. TV available but no remote instructions and no tv. Wireless promised but could not get on. Left 2 hours earlier than planned. Airport transportation was taxi paid by hotel. This days inn should not be offered by expedia. Room rates are not posted but rate paid expedia was definitely not a discounted rate and offers amenities under false pretense. Traveling alone and expecting to board a shuttle clearly marked for hotel, I was alarmed to find the services promised were not available. No woman should be asked to wait at the front of taxi line for hotel shuttle which is not clearly marked only to find the establishment does not have a shuttle but uses taxi when I had booked expedia with two major priorities: airport shuttle and breakfast. Please remove this establishment from your website
review.negativeRemarks: If no access to shuttle do not offer it. Establish standards for free breakfast. No dining area. No breakfast. No shuttle service. No offer
review.locationRemarks: Industrial. This is a motel

review.title: Can try
review.reviewText: Not bad with this price...

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: This hotel was dirty. There was a dirty towel in the dresser drawers that was probably left there from the previous guests. The carpet was sticky and dirty, and appeared as if it has never been vacuumed or shampooed. The bed sheets were dirty and the comforter had cigarette burns. The bathroom floors are cracked and the ceiling looked out and out dated. The remote for the television did not work. This hotel can really use new mattresses. The continental breakfast was near empty and the Coffee airpot was empty. The fruits in the fruit stand were shriveled up and rotten. I don't recommend this hotel at all. The price may be the lowest around that area but for that level of cleanliness, you will be better off spending more and staying elsewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: The only positive attribute about this hotel is that it offered on site parking, even though the spaces were tight and small.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel needs a new make over. The carpet needs shampooing or replacement. The place just looks run-down and dirty.
review.locationRemarks: The location is easy access for getting off and on to the freeway.

review.title: Close to Candlestick, but not worth it!
review.reviewText: We chose this hotel because it was close to Candlestick Park and the price was right, but what a mistake. The room was appropriately sized for a family of four, but there were a multitude of issues with the room. The bathroom door was disgustingly filthy and looked like it had been kicked down recently as the door moulding was pieced together and not painted. The closet doors were off their hinges and although we attempted to put them back on so that we could close them, they were so damaged it was impossible. The room was non-smoking but one of the bedspreads had a large cigarette burn in it. The remote to the tv did not turn the tv on or adjust the volume, but the channels could be changed. The room was arranged for a four person occupancy; however, there were only two towels and washcloths in the room. The room had a sensor for the light, so while we were watching tv laying on the beds, the lights would randomly go off and someone would have to walk around the room to turn them back on-what a pain in the butt! The sink in the bathroom must have had a clog because it drained super slowly. The small fridge in the room was nice! The shower enclosure was also nice. Parking was horrible!
review.negativeRemarks: What couldn't be improved is a much easier answer!
review.locationRemarks: The Country Cottage Kitchen for breakfast and Bertolucci's for fine steak/Italian dining. SF airport and Candlestick Park are close.

review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable Clean Room. Manager is very helpful and friendly. Makes you feel welcome.

review.title: Terrible hotel
review.reviewText:
Horrible service.
Cold face at reception.
No laundry.
No shuttle bus to anywhere.
Tiny space to park cars
No refund when u check out earlier for emergency.

review.title: convenient
review.reviewText: we like the hotel. the clerks are all quite friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: if another room on the first floor could be developed into a lobby for the guests to rest and have breakfast, it would be better and nice.

review.title: Transportation
review.reviewText: Easy to San Francisco,especially BART strike is going on. Good environment,traffic noises are minimum.

I didn't realize that it was an outside entrance & that was the big surprise. The lady in the lobby was great. Also no bar or eating place. I wish I had been told. She was nice though to tell me the closest place for food.
review.negativeRemarks: I was there mainly to sleep to catch a 6 a.m. flight & needed a shuttle. hey used a cab as the shuttle wasn't a 24 hour that I thought.
review.locationRemarks: no clue

review.title: light breakfast
review.reviewText:
I selected the hotel because of:
1. Location
2. Price
3. Has breakfast

The breakfast is -"light breakfast" which is disapointing

review.title: Terrible stay in days inn
review.reviewText: The hotel is very noise due to the outside traffic and inside water leaking in the bathroom. I reserved one room for 3 days and checked out after the first day.

review.title: Great Hotel workers
review.reviewText: Good experience. Wish it had a pool and more parking spaces.

review.title: great Hotel for stopover close to SFO
review.reviewText: Although I arrived late in SFO after plane had been delayed at Mn the staff were so kind and helpful and I was able to store my Luggage the next morning as I had a late departure-I had a very pleasant night the room was quiet and suited my needs-I would recommend this hotel to guests without transport as bus stopped outside and ony $2 to city and staff most helpful with directions and taking me to SFO in plenty of time for my departure ( the shuttle is Hotel run only so you phone the hotel if its required from SFO)

review.title: Disapointed
review.reviewText: Old blankets and comfirter on bed had holes. Felt dirty. Continental breakfast ????????

review.title: Stink manager !!!
review.reviewText:
The manager has no manners and doesn't know anything about the service industry. I found him to be extremely verbally abusive and refuses to listen to the guest. He believes he knows everything but in this case he was absolutely WRONG.
The complimentary airport shuttle service is misleading and the Yellow Cab company that they use is abusive as well !

The staff is afraid of the manager, therefore, he will not listen to reason. But to be verbally abused is unacceptable !!!
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the manager

review.title: Good value for the money.
review.reviewText: Overall the place was decent and adequate. It was sufficiently clean. Shower was great, lots of hot water.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast was terrible. Water downed coffee and a tiny indivually wrapped Danish.
review.negativeRemarks: Give details about the breakfast in the amenities section of the hotel description.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location, that was a plus.

review.title: Close to the airport but no luxury stay
review.reviewText: I booked this hotel last minute and after reading reviews tried to cancel but their cancellation policy costs as much as you pay for the room. When I arrived we got our room and headed to the second floor, only to find the bed unmade and the room smelling like smoke. My boyfriend and I quickly went down to the manager and asked to be upgraded to a better room. They put us on the third floor in a larger room with a couch. This room was fine for the price and the tv had a lot of channels. We just needed the room for the night and it was close to the airport. I don't think I would stay again and if I could have gotten a refund upon canceling I would have been better off.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the room and the breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is very close to the airport

review.title: Clean hotel
review.reviewText: Good place to stay for the price. Stayed one night did not have any issues. Free parking and about 10 minutes from Pier 39 and AT&T park.
review.positiveRemarks: That it was clean and includes parking.

review.title: Terrible.
review.reviewText: So out of the way from everything. Dirty. The staff, especially at the front desk, is not helpful whatsoever. No breakfast. And they ration the amount of towels you can have. Can't believe Days Inn lets these people keep their name on the front.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: Out of the way.

review.title: close to airport
review.reviewText: taxi was there to take me to airport on time. had nothing else to offer, it's just a motel worth $50 per night in some smaller locations.
review.positiveRemarks: didn't spend too much time. Not much to like or dislike
review.negativeRemarks: it's just a motel
review.locationRemarks: near the airport

review.title: For one night, it's ok.
review.reviewText: The breakfast was poor; coffee, juice and one kind of pastries. No place to eat. We eat in our room. The lobby and the room was very tiny but very clean. The keeper of the hotel was a very kind person and he answered our questions with professionalism. He give us all the informations we need, very clearly and kindly. Francine
review.negativeRemarks: The tiny room.

review.title: Average hotel
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel due to proximity to airport, with free shuttle. It was adequate for my short stay.
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast was pretty slim, the bathtub had black marks all inside of it, made it look dirty.

review.title: great hotel for quick trips close to everything
review.reviewText: Overall hotel and room were very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful

review.title: Modest hotel
review.reviewText: Although the hotel is bit old, it's not bad to stay. The room was kept clean and I had no complaint about facilities. Cost performance was not bad. I recommend this hotel to travelers who seek cheap hotel with a modestly comfortable room. The complementary breakfast shouldn't be expected of sufficient one. The location might be inconvenient even if you don't have a car. But there is a bus station near the hotel and thus you can reasonably go to the airport or The downtown.

review.title: Bogus "Shuttle"--try elsewhere!
review.reviewText:
The "free airport shutle" turned out to be a phone number for a cab company on contract to the hotel. They did not answer. The hotel refunded $14 of my $21 cab fare; vfor the return shuttle to the airport, the hotel clerk said it was pre-covered, and the cab driver expected ME to pay him.

Not a good experience for a late-ariving, tired traveler. Ttry some other place.

review.title: Best choice for your buck
review.reviewText:
Awesome place for the price I paid... in fact worth more than that...
Exterior looks humble but rooms are maintained very nicely... it was all pleasing and hygienic. Everything promised was present in good working condition.

Unlike most of the places of this range, bathroom was clean and shining... highlight was deep bath tub.

Breakfast served is not the typical continental and is just coffee, juice and doughnuts... but then you dont stay in a hotel for breakfast ;)
review.positiveRemarks: Clean and well maintained rooms, lot of tv channels, Clean bathroom

review.title: Don't expect too much.
review.reviewText: Not a welcoming setup - staff was fine but we had to ring to get into hotel lobby. Wait for the attendant to let us into a 10'x 10' lobby area to check in. Then outside to the parking lot where the elevator was located and up to room. No security on elevator so anyone could use it to get access to upper hotel floors. Was fine for the overnight stay between flight for us but wouldn't stay there for an extended time. Airport shuttle not available for late arrivals so we took a taxi. Shuttle to airport the next morning was a taxi also but covered by the hotel. Wonder why they couldn't cover the ride to the hotel????
review.negativeRemarks: ran out of orange juice and coffee. THeir continental breakfast was coffee, orange juice and convenience store wrapped pastries.

review.title: Average over night accommodation
review.reviewText: The service to pick me up from the airport was satisfactory although I still had to make two calls to arrange my taxi. The breakfast was very disappointing as there was no where to sit, you just picked up some health bars or muffin type food and an apple with coffee in the small reception area, not at all good! The room itself was clean and comfortable and had what I required but a little old.

review.title: Good hotel - not as far from downtown as I thought
review.reviewText:
A decent hotel - not too far from downtown San Francisco and most of the major attractions. We saved a few dollars compared to the rates downtown - spent it on fantastic food!
Could not stay here if you didn't have your own car though!

review.title: Should charge under $60 for such a product
review.reviewText: Expected basics which were missing? Not worth the money paid
review.negativeRemarks: X
review.locationRemarks: X

review.title: Not good to stay at, would not stay there agian.
review.reviewText:
When we arrived at the hotel we noticed there were several window screens damaged or broken. Our room had only one set of towels. We had to ask for more towels so they gave us several small towels, we them had to ask again they gave us only two large towels. The walls in the room had area's (two) that was not painted they was another barren wall that had hooks for a picture. The bed sheets were clean but the other blankets had holes in it.
One of the bed mattresses had a large stain on it. The heater/Air conditioner only put out a small amount of cool air. The Carpets were very dirty and the chairs had stains on them.
review.negativeRemarks: When we(my wife and my daughter)was walking to our room, another person had there room propped open, they made some neg. remarks to us as we walked by
review.locationRemarks: Loacation was good.

review.title: disappointing
review.reviewText: Breakfast was minimal, phone was not working in my room

review.title: lyers...
review.reviewText:
It is a cheap hotel, so you get what you pay for, but it is ok. A little bit noisy by the road, but close to the airport, and not far from SF.

I choose this hotel because it is said you have a complimentary breakfast, what is totaly wrong. You just can have a fruit and a snack without any table of course, what is absolutely not a breakfast. Then it was said free shuttle for the airport. But when you want to reserve it, they say it is $12-13. The taxi was $19.

Then the old woman I met several times is not nice at all...

I just paid for something I didn't get.

review.title: kindly gave it 3 stars
review.reviewText: I gave this place the best rating that I could. You cannot expect more from a place that cannot even put enough light bulbs in a lamp to make it fully funtional. I guess saving a bulb in each of the lamps in the room is making them rich.

review.title: Quality stay
review.reviewText: Reasonably price. Good location. I would come back and stay at this hotel again.

review.title: OK Place to Stay
review.reviewText: There was slime growing on the inside of the faucet handle. Room very noisy due to street traffic, but other than that it was fine for the money.

review.title: good experience
review.reviewText: the hotel is located well and the staff was also good.
review.positiveRemarks: good staff. gave suggestions about places to see in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: The noise from the traffic outside.
review.locationRemarks: Good.

review.title: we are extremely satisfied and want to ga back again.
review.reviewText: We want to express our thank you for the warm accomodation extended to us during our stay at Days Inn Oyster Point. The room was clean, and my group were very satisfied and happy. Thank you and we will come back again.

review.title: Poor breakfast
review.reviewText:
We knew this was not going to be the best hotel we would ever stay in, but it would suffice for what we needed we thought, but the breakfast was almost non existent. Coffee (horrible), weak orange juice and a pastry (I think!) in a packet, that was all that was offered, we needed to go and buy breakfast every day as my children would not eat it, and I was actually glad of that.
We also had a problem with our booking as the hotel said we were only booked as a party of 4 but we were actually 5, and even though I had all the paperwork with me, they insisted it was me who was wrong!

review.title: You'll get what you'v paid
review.reviewText: Very nice reception, affordable and clean room. Needs some improvement especially for breakfast.

review.title: Good value; convenient location; friendly staff.
review.reviewText: I'd stayed in this hotel previously and found it in better condition and the staff more friendly than I remembered. All in all though, still clean, reasonably priced and convenient to my destination and the airport.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Over all it was good, room was clean, housekeeping was prompt, location was not bad, just make a U-turn to get to highway. Nice sandwich shop within walking distance. Hotel is close to highway, so you will hear cars if your fan is not on, but is was not too bad. They have a breakfast but it is not worth your time unless you want fruit or danish. I Hop is right up the road. The hotel staff was nice and helpful.

review.title: Their taxi service is really poor, and they never contacted you if you had a concern
review.reviewText: I expected they provide shuttle bus but they only had taxi service. It's okay BUT their taxi service is really poor. Ignoring a foreigner and unfamiliar with the SFO airport I am, the taxi company is very impatient to guide me how to take their taxi, gave me the WRONG instruction and yelled at me which made me took the wrong taxi. This Days Inn refuse to handle my case. I left a letter to the manager but he is always out and never contacted me since 3 weeks has passed. Don't expect too much to be respected in this Days Inn!! : (
review.userLocation: Days Inn San Francisco South/Oyster Point Airport

review.title: Not worth the price.
review.reviewText: Low quality hotel for the price. Not anywhere near a BART station.

review.title: Good value; convenient location
review.reviewText:
It was a friendly little hotel. I wasn't paying attention, or it wasn't noted, when I booked that I had reserved a smoking room. I'm not a smoker, and found that the room had heavy residual smoke smell, and the decor seemed dingy from the smoke as well. The residual smoke smell was strong enough that more than one person noticed that it had been picked up on my clothes. One of the lamps was inoperative, and despite a couple requests to fix during the course of a 4 night stay, it never got done.
That said, although this is by no means a luxury hotel, the staff was always friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, and I found the location convenient both to my destinations in the city and SFO. Easy access right off the 101, and there were a few restaurants within a few minutes drive.
I'd stay there again, but will make sure when booking future reservatiions that I specify non-smoking rooms.

review.title: A room and a parking place--no yard--can't go outside
review.reviewText: The room assigned to us smelled so bad of smoking--we want non-smoking. The door was propped open airing it out--and remained that way all week--yet they tried to foist it on us. The manager went out of his way to be kind. He found us a non-smoking room (the handicap one) but it had one bed instead of two and was very tiny. It was an all cement yard with parking under the hotel so we could not stay around--room too small. The continental breakfast was in the tiny lobby (just a place to stand at the desk) and was celephane wrapped sweet rolls and coffee and juice. The hotel was on a one-way so it was always a pain to go up some block and turn around to go anywhere. I wouldn't stay there again, but it was okay this time because we had places to go.

review.title: Spot on. Comfotable, immaculately clean, and a great experience.
review.reviewText:
There's not a lot I can say! The place was faultless. The check in took a matter of moments, and the room was immaculate. Everything worked perfectly. The TV had hundreds of channels, the air conditioning was easy to use, the shower was powerful and piping hot. Beds were large and comfortable.

Each day, left the room to be tidied, and everything was perfect when I got back. We were there for 7 nights, and apart from check in and out, we didnt speak to a soul. We didn't need to!

review.title: Good if you want to be close but not too close to downtown.
review.reviewText: My friends and I went there for a 49er's game. Candlestick was 5 minute away. the downtown area was about 10 minutes away. Everything from there like Chinatown and Fishermans Wharf is max ten minutes away. The bridge isn't too far either I would say 15-20 minutes. The service was good and we're the cleanest people. We stayed for 2 nights. We even left cash on top of the television to see if the maids were honest and they were. Overall good stay if you only want to sleep and wake up there.

review.title: Good for price
review.reviewText: The check in was very quick and easy. Clean confortable room no frills.

review.title: Convenient, very helpful desk agent, but terrible air
review.reviewText: First the pluses: Very nice agent who resolved an Expedia reservation problem to our satisfaction; super conveniently located (short drive to SF); had just what we needed to stop, sleep & go. Minuses: The smell of the air in the room was terrible. It was as if we were breathing the exhalations of all the guests in the hotel from the entire day. I don't know how the ventilation works, but it was not a pleasant experience.

review.title: Excellent Budget Stay
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay before taking a test the next day. Extremely close to hwy 101. I recommend this hotel.

review.title: I get to see my spanish channels
review.reviewText: The room was big and everything looked clean nice shower.

review.title: aweful
review.reviewText: piece of crap

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: It was "ok". I've stayed at numerous Days Inn's before and this one was one least desirable ones I have stayed at. The room was just sort of dingy. It was clean enough I guess, but it just wasn't as nice as I expected. It was also facing a major road, so there was traffic noise all night, and all the rooms seemed to face this road. All in all I would rate it about a 4 on a scale of 1-10.
